tuv.seg: Access to money after a death
Rochtain ar airgead i ndiaidh an bháis
When someone in Ireland dies, it is their personal representative who distributes their money and property according to the law
Nuair a fhaigheann duine bás in Éirinn, bíonn ionadaí pearsanta an duine freagrach as a airgead agus a réadmhaoin a dháileadh amach de réir an dlí
Occasionally, difficulties can arise where a bereaved person may need to get access to some of the deceased person's money to pay for funeral expenses
Bíonn deacrachtaí ann ó am go ham nuair a bhíonn ar mhuintir an mharbhánaigh rochtain a fháil ar airgead an duine éagtha chun na costais sochraide a íoc
It may also transpire for example, that a dependent spouse/civil partner or children may need to get access for living expenses, at least until a social welfare payment is awarded

Ó am go ham freisin, bíonn ar chéile/páirtí sibhialta nó ar leanaí an duine éagtha rochtain a fháil ar an airgead chun costais mhaireachtála a íoc, nó roimh a n-íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh a fháil ar a laghad
It is not easy to get immediate access to the deceased person's money unless it is in a joint account
Níl sé éasca airgead an duine éagtha a rochtain ar an bpointe, ach amháin nuair a bhíonn comh-chuntas i gceist
There are a range of payments provided by the Department of Social Protection that are available to help out families during this difficult time
Tá roinnt íocaíochtaí difriúla ar fáil ón Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí chun cabhrú le teaghlaigh le linn na tréimhse deacra seo
Money in the bank or building society
Airgead sa bhanc nó sa chumann foirgníochta
If money in the bank/building society is in the deceased's name only, then you usually cannot get access to it until probate is taken out
Má bhíonn cuntais bhainc nó chumainn foirgníochta in ainm an duine éagtha amháin, ní fhéadtar rochtain a fháil ar an airgead seo de ghnáth, roimh phrobháid a fháil

If the amount of money is small, the financial institution may release it provided the personal representatives or the next of kin sign an indemnity form. In effect, this is a guarantee that the bank/building society will not be at a loss if there are other claims on the money

Nuair a bhíonn méid beag airgid i gceist, is féidir leis an institiúid airgeadais an t-airgead seo a scaoileadh má shíníonn an ionadaí pearsanta nó an gaol is giorra foirm slánaíochta – is urrú é seo nach mbeidh aon chaillteanas ag titim ar an mbanc/ar an gcumann foirgníochta má dhéantar éileamh eile ar an airgead
If the account is held jointly with a person other than the deceased's spouse/civil partner (e.g
Má tá an cuntas i gcomhúinéireacht le duine eile seachas do chéile/páirtí sibhialta (m.sh
the deceased's brother or parent) talk to the bank or building society. They may need a statement from the Revenue Commissioners' Capital Taxes Office
tá cuntas agat le do dheartháir, do pháirtí nó tuismitheoir) déan teagmháil leis an mbanc nó cumann foirgníochta
This will allow you to transfer money while any possible tax liability, such as Capital Acquisitions Tax (CAT), is being examined

Bíonn ort ráiteas a fháil ó Oifig Chánach Chaipitil na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim i gcásanna áirithe agus is féidir leat é seo a úsáid chun airgead a aistriú agus scrúdú á dhéanamh ar aon dliteanas cánach, mar Cáin Fháltais Caipitiúil (CFC), a d’fhéadfadh a bheith i gceist
Spouses/civil partners are not liable for CAT on inheritances from each other
Níl ar chéilí/páirtnéirí sibhialta CFC a íoc ar na hoidhreachtaí a fhaigheann siad óna chéile
You should apply to the Capital Taxes Office of the Revenue Commissioners for a letter of clearance
Ba cheart duit iarratas a chur isteach chuig Oifig Chánach Chaipitil na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim chun litir imréitigh a fháil
If you think the deceased person may have had a dormant bank account, you should contact the financial institution at which the account was held
Má cheapann tú go bhfuil cuntas bainc díomhaoin ag an duine éagtha, ba cheart duit teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an institiúid airgeadais inar osclaíodh an cuntas
If that financial institution no longer exists and you want to find out where to make your enquiry or claim, you should contact the Banking and Payments Federation Ireland (BPFI)

Mura bhfuil an institiúid airgeadais fós ann agus más mian leat faisnéis a fháil ar conas d’fhiosrúchán nó d’éileamh a chur isteach, ba cheart duit teagmháil a dhéanamh le Baincéireachta agus Íocaíochtaí Cónaidhm na hÉireann (BPFI)
Find out more about dormant accounts here
Cliceáil anseo chun breis faisnéise a rochtain ar chuntais dhíomhaoin
For accounts in one name only:
Cuntais in ainm amháin:

• If the investor had left instructions on a 'nomination form', the proceeds of the savings deposit account or Savings Certificates (i.e the principal plus accrued interest) will be distributed according to those instructions

• Má leagadh amach treoracha roimh ré ar 'fhoirm ainmniúcháin', déanfar an t-airgead ón gcuntas taisce coigiltis nó ó na Cairteacha Coigiltis (nó an phríomhshuim móide ú fabhraithe) a dháileadh amach de réir na treoracha seo
• If the investor had made a will, the proceeds will be distributed in accordance with the will
• Má bhíonn uacht ar fáil, déanfar an t-airgead a dháileadh amach de réir na treoracha san uacht
• If there is no will, the usual rules for inheritance will apply
• Mura mbíonn uacht ar fáil, ní mór duit na gnáthrialacha oidhreachta a chomhlíonadh
Whether there is a will or not, you will need to obtain probate or Letters of Administration from the High Court if the proceeds are more than €10,000
Nuair a bhíonn níos mó ná €10,000 i gceist, bíonn ort priobháid nó Litreacha Riaracháin a fháil ón Ard-Chúirt. Ní mór duit é seo a dhéanamh i ngach cás
If the amount involved is less than €10,000, you will not have to wait to take out a grant of probate
Má bhíonn níos lú ná €10,000 i gceist, is féidir leat deonú priobháide a fháil ar an bpointe
All you have to do is get a claim form from any post office and send it with the following:
Ní mór duit ach foirm éilimh a fháil ó Oifig an Phoist agus í a sheoladh isteach leis na doiciméid seo a leanas:
• Post Office deposit book (keep a record of the number)
• Leabhar taisce an Phoist (scríobh an uimhir síos in áit slán)
• Original will or certified copy of the will (this will be returned by registered post)
• An bhunuacht nó cóip deimhnithe den bhunuacht (seolfar é ar ais chugat tríd an post)
to the Post Office Savings Bank, Deceased Section
chuig Rannóg na nDaoine Éagtha, Banc Taisce an Phoist
You will be sent a form of indemnity which you will have to sign before a Peace Commissioner or Commissioner for Oaths, or GP, clergyman or member of the Garda Síochána
Seolfar foirm slánaíochta chugat agus ní mór duit an fhoirm seo a shíniú i bhfianaise Feidhmeannaigh Shíochána nó Coimisinéara Mionn, DG, sagairt nó an Garda Síochána

If the deceased had a credit union account and had completed a valid Nomination Form, when opening the account, nominating someone as next of kin, the proceeds of the account up to a maximum of €23,000 go to the person or persons nominated on the form

Má bhí cuntas chomhar creidmheasa ag an éagach agus má líonadh Foirm Ainmniúcháin bailí ar oscailt an chuntais, agus í ag ainmniú duine mar neasghaol, gabhann fáltais an chuntais suas go €23,000 chuig an duine nó chuig na daoine atá ainmnithe ar an fhoirm
They do not form part of the deceased's estate
Níl siad mar chuid d’eastáit an éagaigh
The balance of the account forms part of the deceased's estate and is distributed in accordance with succession law
Is é iarmheid an chuntais atá mar chuid d’estáit an éagaigh agus tá sé dáilte de réir dlí chomharbais
If an insurance policy names you as the beneficiary, then you may claim it directly from the insurance company
Má léirítear d’ainm mar thairbhí ar pholasaí árachais, is féidir leat an t-airgead a fháil go díreach ón gcomhlacht árachais
You need a death certificate
Chun é seo a dhéanamh, ní mór duit deimhniú báis a bheith agat
If there is no named beneficiary, then the proceeds form part of the overall estate of the deceased and are distributed with the other assets
Mura léirítear tairbhí san uacht, déanfar an t-airgead seo a dháileadh amach leis na sócmhainní eile a thagann faoi eastát an duine éagtha
Find out about different types of insurance here
Cliceáil anseo chun faisnéis a rochtain ar na pinsin árachais dhifriúla atá ar fáil
Occupational and personal pensions
Pinsin cheirde agus phearsanta
The rules governing occupational and personal pensions vary
Baineann rialacha difriúla le pinsin cheirde agus phearsanta

If the deceased was a member of a pension scheme, you should contact the employer or former employer or the scheme administrators to find out if there is a pension for the spouse/civil partner and/or children

I gcás go raibh páirt á ghlacadh ag an duine éagtha i scéim phinsin, ba cheart duit teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an bhfostóir, leis an iarfhostóir nó le riarthóirí na scéime chun a fháil amach an bhfuil pinsean ar fáil don chéile/páirtí sibhialta agus/nó do na leanaí
Self-employed people may have pension arrangements which involve some of the investments becoming part of the deceased's estate
Bíonn pinsin ag daoine féinfhostaithe ó am go ham a dhéanann roinnt dá infheistíochtaí a dháileadh amach mar chuid d’eastát an duine éagtha

Divorced people and those whose civil partnership has been dissolved may have access to some part of the pension scheme depending on whether or not a pension adjustment order was made at the time of the divorce/dissolution

Is féidir le daoine scartha agus iad siúd a bhfuil comhpháirtíocht sibhialta scuireadh rochtain a fháil ar roinnt earnálacha den scéim phinsin ag brath ar an ordú ceartú pinsin déanta ag am an cholscartha
The Pensions Authority have a series of leaflets on pension matters for scheme members
Tá roinnt bileoga ar fáil ón tÚdarás Pinsin a sholáthraíonn faisnéis do bhaill scéime ar ábhar pinsin
There is more information on pensions here
Cliceáil anseo chun breis faisnéise a fháil ar phinsin
